text: The Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation (BIMSTEC) is an international organization with seven member countries in South Asia and South East Asia.BIMSTEC: Building bridges between South Asia & Southeast Asia , IndiaWrites, 2014. The member countries of this organization are Bangladesh, India, Myanmar, Sri Lanka, Thailand, Nepal and Bhutan. All these are countries are around the Bay of Bengal.http://www.thedailystar.net/op-ed/economics/regional-economic- integration-the-bay-bengal-660181 == Lead == Each country leads the organization for two in alphabetical order. It started with Bangladesh in 1997-1999. == Member countries == Country Name Headship Chief Executive Officer Government leadership population ( ) Domestic production (nominal) World Bank South Asian Association Prime Minister Zeke Hasina, Prime Minister of Bengal Abdul Hameed, President of the Republic of Bengal $285.8 billion ✔ ✔ Prime Minister Tasso Tsering Wanchuk, Prime Minister of Bhutan Jigmi Kesar Namjil Wangchuck, King of Bhutan $2.2 billion ✔ ✔ Prime Minister Narendra Modi , Prime Minister of India Ram Nath Kovind, President of the Republic $2308.0 bn ✔ ✔ Chairman Win Myint, President of Myanmar $68.277 billion ✔ ✖ Prime Minister Khadka Prasad Oli, Prime Minister of Nepal Pitya Devi Bhandari, President of Nepal $74.020 bn ✔ ✔ President of the Republic Ranil Vikram Singh, Prime Minister of Sri Lanka Maithripala Sirisena, President of Sri Lanka $80.4 billion ✔ ✔ Prime Minister Prayuth Chan-o-cha, Prime Minister of Thailand King Vajiralongkorn (Tenth Rama), King of Thailand $409.724 billion ✔ ✖ ==References== Category:Bay of Bengal
title: Bay of Bengal Initiative for Multi-Sectoral Technical and Economic Cooperation
